079/**
080 * A {@link CategoryItemRenderer} that draws individual data items as bars.
081 * The example shown here is generated by the {@code BarChartDemo1.java}
082 * program included in the JFreeChart Demo Collection:
083 * <br><br>
084 * <img src="doc-files/BarChartDemo1.svg" alt="BarChartDemo1.svg">
085 */
086public class BarRenderer extends AbstractCategoryItemRenderer
087        implements Cloneable, PublicCloneable, Serializable {
088
089    private BarRendererProduct barRendererProduct = new BarRendererProduct();
090
091        /** For serialization. */
092    private static final long serialVersionUID = 6000649414965887481L;
093
094    /** The default item margin percentage. */
095    public static final double DEFAULT_ITEM_MARGIN = 0.20;
096
097    /**
098     * Constant that controls the minimum width before a bar has an outline
099     * drawn.
100     */
101    public static final double BAR_OUTLINE_WIDTH_THRESHOLD = 3.0;
102
103    /**
104     * The default bar painter assigned to each new instance of this renderer.
105     */
106    private static BarPainter defaultBarPainter = new GradientBarPainter();
107
108    /**
109     * Returns the default bar painter.
110     *
111     * @return The default bar painter.
112     */
113    public static BarPainter getDefaultBarPainter() {
114        return BarRenderer.defaultBarPainter;
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Sets the default bar painter.
119     *
120     * @param painter  the painter ({@code null} not permitted).
121     */
122    public static void setDefaultBarPainter(BarPainter painter) {
123        Args.nullNotPermitted(painter, "painter");
124        BarRenderer.defaultBarPainter = painter;
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * The default value for the initialisation of the shadowsVisible flag.
129     */
130    private static boolean defaultShadowsVisible = true;
131
132    /**
133     * Returns the default value for the {@code shadowsVisible} flag.
134     *
135     * @return A boolean.
136     *
137     * @see #setDefaultShadowsVisible(boolean)
138     */
139    public static boolean getDefaultShadowsVisible() {
140        return BarRenderer.defaultShadowsVisible;
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Sets the default value for the shadows visible flag.
145     *
146     * @param visible  the new value for the default.
147     *
148     * @see #getDefaultShadowsVisible()
149     */
150    public static void setDefaultShadowsVisible(boolean visible) {
151        BarRenderer.defaultShadowsVisible = visible;
152    }
153
154    /** The margin between items (bars) within a category. */
155    private double itemMargin;
156
157    /** A flag that controls whether or not bar outlines are drawn. */
158    private boolean drawBarOutline;
159
160    /** The maximum bar width as a percentage of the available space. */
161    private double maximumBarWidth;
162
163    /** The minimum bar length (in Java2D units). */
164    private double minimumBarLength;
165
166    /**
167     * An optional class used to transform gradient paint objects to fit each
168     * bar.
169     */
170    private GradientPaintTransformer gradientPaintTransformer;
171
172    /** The upper clip (axis) value for the axis. */
173    private double upperClip;
174    // TODO:  this needs to move into the renderer state
175
176    /** The lower clip (axis) value for the axis. */
177    private double lowerClip;
178    // TODO:  this needs to move into the renderer state
179
180    /** The base value for the bars (defaults to 0.0). */
181    private double base;
182
183    /**
184     * A flag that controls whether the base value is included in the range
185     * returned by the findRangeBounds() method.
186     */
187    private boolean includeBaseInRange;
188
189    /**
190     * The bar painter (never {@code null}).
191     */
192    private BarPainter barPainter;
193
194    /**
195     * The flag that controls whether or not shadows are drawn for the bars.
196     */
197    private boolean shadowsVisible;
198
199    /**
200     * The shadow paint.
201     */
202    private transient Paint shadowPaint;
203
204    /**
205     * The x-offset for the shadow effect.
206     */
207    private double shadowXOffset;
208
209    /**
210     * The y-offset for the shadow effect.
211     */
212    private double shadowYOffset;
213
214    /**
215     * Creates a new bar renderer with default settings.
216     */
217    public BarRenderer() {
218        super();
219        this.base = 0.0;
220        this.includeBaseInRange = true;
221        this.itemMargin = DEFAULT_ITEM_MARGIN;
222        this.drawBarOutline = false;
223        this.maximumBarWidth = 1.0;
224            // 100 percent, so it will not apply unless changed
225        barRendererProduct.setPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback2(null);
226        barRendererProduct.setNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback2(null);
227        this.gradientPaintTransformer = new StandardGradientPaintTransformer();
228        this.minimumBarLength = 0.0;
229        setDefaultLegendShape(new Rectangle2D.Double(-4.0, -4.0, 8.0, 8.0));
230        this.barPainter = getDefaultBarPainter();
231        this.shadowsVisible = getDefaultShadowsVisible();
232        this.shadowPaint = Color.GRAY;
233        this.shadowXOffset = 4.0;
234        this.shadowYOffset = 4.0;
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Returns the base value for the bars.  The default value is
239     * {@code 0.0}.
240     *
241     * @return The base value for the bars.
242     *
243     * @see #setBase(double)
244     */
245    public double getBase() {
246        return this.base;
247    }
248
249    /**
250     * Sets the base value for the bars and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent}
251     * to all registered listeners.
252     *
253     * @param base  the new base value.
254     *
255     * @see #getBase()
256     */
257    public void setBase(double base) {
258        this.base = base;
259        fireChangeEvent();
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Returns the item margin as a percentage of the available space for all
264     * bars.
265     *
266     * @return The margin percentage (where 0.10 is ten percent).
267     *
268     * @see #setItemMargin(double)
269     */
270    public double getItemMargin() {
271        return this.itemMargin;
272    }
273
274    /**
275     * Sets the item margin and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all
276     * registered listeners.  The value is expressed as a percentage of the
277     * available width for plotting all the bars, with the resulting amount to
278     * be distributed between all the bars evenly.
279     *
280     * @param percent  the margin (where 0.10 is ten percent).
281     *
282     * @see #getItemMargin()
283     */
284    public void setItemMargin(double percent) {
285        this.itemMargin = percent;
286        fireChangeEvent();
287    }
288
289    /**
290     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not bar outlines are drawn.
291     *
292     * @return A boolean.
293     *
294     * @see #setDrawBarOutline(boolean)
295     */
296    public boolean isDrawBarOutline() {
297        return this.drawBarOutline;
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not bar outlines are drawn and
302     * sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
303     *
304     * @param draw  the flag.
305     *
306     * @see #isDrawBarOutline()
307     */
308    public void setDrawBarOutline(boolean draw) {
309        this.drawBarOutline = draw;
310        fireChangeEvent();
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Returns the maximum bar width, as a percentage of the available drawing
315     * space.
316     *
317     * @return The maximum bar width.
318     *
319     * @see #setMaximumBarWidth(double)
320     */
321    public double getMaximumBarWidth() {
322        return this.maximumBarWidth;
323    }
324
325    /**
326     * Sets the maximum bar width, which is specified as a percentage of the
327     * available space for all bars, and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to
328     * all registered listeners.
329     *
330     * @param percent  the percent (where 0.05 is five percent).
331     *
332     * @see #getMaximumBarWidth()
333     */
334    public void setMaximumBarWidth(double percent) {
335        this.maximumBarWidth = percent;
336        fireChangeEvent();
337    }
338
339    /**
340     * Returns the minimum bar length (in Java2D units).  The default value is
341     * 0.0.
342     *
343     * @return The minimum bar length.
344     *
345     * @see #setMinimumBarLength(double)
346     */
347    public double getMinimumBarLength() {
348        return this.minimumBarLength;
349    }
350
351    /**
352     * Sets the minimum bar length and sends a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to
353     * all registered listeners.  The minimum bar length is specified in Java2D
354     * units, and can be used to prevent bars that represent very small data
355     * values from disappearing when drawn on the screen.  Typically you would
356     * set this to (say) 0.5 or 1.0 Java 2D units.  Use this attribute with
357     * caution, however, because setting it to a non-zero value will
358     * artificially increase the length of bars representing small values,
359     * which may misrepresent your data.
360     *
361     * @param min  the minimum bar length (in Java2D units, must be &gt;= 0.0).
362     *
363     * @see #getMinimumBarLength()
364     */
365    public void setMinimumBarLength(double min) {
366        if (min < 0.0) {
367            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Requires 'min' >= 0.0");
368        }
369        this.minimumBarLength = min;
370        fireChangeEvent();
371    }
372
373    /**
374     * Returns the gradient paint transformer (an object used to transform
375     * gradient paint objects to fit each bar).
376     *
377     * @return A transformer ({@code null} possible).
378     *
379     * @see #setGradientPaintTransformer(GradientPaintTransformer)
380     */
381    public GradientPaintTransformer getGradientPaintTransformer() {
382        return this.gradientPaintTransformer;
383    }
384
385    /**
386     * Sets the gradient paint transformer and sends a
387     * {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
388     *

390     *
391     * @see #getGradientPaintTransformer()
392     */
393    public void setGradientPaintTransformer(
394            GradientPaintTransformer transformer) {
395        this.gradientPaintTransformer = transformer;
396        fireChangeEvent();
397    }

465    /**
466     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not the base value for the bars
467     * is included in the range calculated by
468     * {@link #findRangeBounds(CategoryDataset)}.  If the flag is changed,
469     * a {@link RendererChangeEvent} is sent to all registered listeners.
470     *
471     * @param include  the new value for the flag.
472     *
473     * @see #getIncludeBaseInRange()
474     */
475    public void setIncludeBaseInRange(boolean include) {
476        if (this.includeBaseInRange != include) {
477            this.includeBaseInRange = include;
478            fireChangeEvent();
479        }
480    }

593    /**
594     * Returns the lower clip value.  This value is recalculated in the
595     * initialise() method.
596     *
597     * @return The value.
598     */
599    public double getLowerClip() {
600        // TODO:  this attribute should be transferred to the renderer state.
601        return this.lowerClip;
602    }
603
604    /**
605     * Returns the upper clip value.  This value is recalculated in the
606     * initialise() method.
607     *
608     * @return The value.
609     */
610    public double getUpperClip() {
611        // TODO:  this attribute should be transferred to the renderer state.
612        return this.upperClip;
613    }
614
615    /**
616     * Initialises the renderer and returns a state object that will be passed
617     * to subsequent calls to the drawItem method.  This method gets called
618     * once at the start of the process of drawing a chart.
619     *
620     * @param g2  the graphics device.
621     * @param dataArea  the area in which the data is to be plotted.
622     * @param plot  the plot.
623     * @param rendererIndex  the renderer index.
624     * @param info  collects chart rendering information for return to caller.
625     *
626     * @return The renderer state.
627     */
628    @Override
629    public CategoryItemRendererState initialise(Graphics2D g2, 
630            Rectangle2D dataArea, CategoryPlot plot, int rendererIndex,
631            PlotRenderingInfo info) {
632
633        CategoryItemRendererState state = super.initialise(g2, dataArea, plot,
634                rendererIndex, info);
635
636        // get the clipping values...
637        ValueAxis rangeAxis = plot.getRangeAxisForDataset(rendererIndex);
638        this.lowerClip = rangeAxis.getRange().getLowerBound();
639        this.upperClip = rangeAxis.getRange().getUpperBound();
640
641        // calculate the bar width
642        calculateBarWidth(plot, dataArea, rendererIndex, state);
643
644        return state;
645
646    }
647
648    /**
649     * Calculates the bar width and stores it in the renderer state.
650     *
651     * @param plot  the plot.
652     * @param dataArea  the data area.
653     * @param rendererIndex  the renderer index.
654     * @param state  the renderer state.
655     */
656    protected void calculateBarWidth(CategoryPlot plot,
657                                     Rectangle2D dataArea,
658                                     int rendererIndex,
659                                     CategoryItemRendererState state) {
660
661        CategoryAxis domainAxis = getDomainAxis(plot, rendererIndex);
662        CategoryDataset dataset = plot.getDataset(rendererIndex);
663        if (dataset != null) {
664            int columns = dataset.getColumnCount();
665            int rows = state.getVisibleSeriesCount() >= 0
666                    ? state.getVisibleSeriesCount() : dataset.getRowCount();
667            double space = 0.0;
668            PlotOrientation orientation = plot.getOrientation();
669            if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
670                space = dataArea.getHeight();
671            }
672            else if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
673                space = dataArea.getWidth();
674            }
675            double maxWidth = space * getMaximumBarWidth();
676            double categoryMargin = 0.0;
677            double currentItemMargin = 0.0;
678            if (columns > 1) {
679                categoryMargin = domainAxis.getCategoryMargin();
680            }
681            if (rows > 1) {
682                currentItemMargin = getItemMargin();
683            }
684            double used = space * (1 - domainAxis.getLowerMargin()
685                                     - domainAxis.getUpperMargin()
686                                     - categoryMargin - currentItemMargin);
687            if ((rows * columns) > 0) {
688                state.setBarWidth(Math.min(used / (rows * columns), maxWidth));
689            }
690            else {
691                state.setBarWidth(Math.min(used, maxWidth));
692            }
693        }
694    }
695
696    /**
697     * Calculates the coordinate of the first "side" of a bar.  This will be
698     * the minimum x-coordinate for a vertical bar, and the minimum
699     * y-coordinate for a horizontal bar.
700     *
701     * @param plot  the plot.
702     * @param orientation  the plot orientation.
703     * @param dataArea  the data area.
704     * @param domainAxis  the domain axis.
705     * @param state  the renderer state (has the bar width precalculated).
706     * @param row  the row index.
707     * @param column  the column index.
708     *
709     * @return The coordinate.
710     */
711    protected double calculateBarW0(CategoryPlot plot, 
712            PlotOrientation orientation, Rectangle2D dataArea, 
713            CategoryAxis domainAxis, CategoryItemRendererState state,
714            int row, int column) {
715        // calculate bar width...
716        double space;
717        if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
718            space = dataArea.getHeight();
719        }
720        else {
721            space = dataArea.getWidth();
722        }
723        double barW0 = domainAxis.getCategoryStart(column, getColumnCount(),
724                dataArea, plot.getDomainAxisEdge());
725        int seriesCount = state.getVisibleSeriesCount() >= 0
726                ? state.getVisibleSeriesCount() : getRowCount();
727        int categoryCount = getColumnCount();
728        if (seriesCount > 1) {
729            double seriesGap = space * getItemMargin()
730                               / (categoryCount * (seriesCount - 1));
731            double seriesW = calculateSeriesWidth(space, domainAxis,
732                    categoryCount, seriesCount);
733            barW0 = barW0 + row * (seriesW + seriesGap)
734                          + (seriesW / 2.0) - (state.getBarWidth() / 2.0);
735        }
736        else {
737            barW0 = domainAxis.getCategoryMiddle(column, getColumnCount(),
738                    dataArea, plot.getDomainAxisEdge()) - state.getBarWidth()
739                    / 2.0;
740        }
741        return barW0;
742    }
743
744    /**
745     * Calculates the coordinates for the length of a single bar.
746     *
747     * @param value  the value represented by the bar.
748     *
749     * @return The coordinates for each end of the bar (or {@code null} if
750     *         the bar is not visible for the current axis range).
751     */
752    protected double[] calculateBarL0L1(double value) {
753        double lclip = getLowerClip();
754        double uclip = getUpperClip();
755        double barLow = Math.min(this.base, value);
756        double barHigh = Math.max(this.base, value);
757        if (barHigh < lclip) {  // bar is not visible
758            return null;
759        }
760        if (barLow > uclip) {   // bar is not visible
761            return null;
762        }
763        barLow = Math.max(barLow, lclip);
764        barHigh = Math.min(barHigh, uclip);
765        return new double[] {barLow, barHigh};
766    }
767
768    /**
769     * Returns the range of values the renderer requires to display all the
770     * items from the specified dataset.  This takes into account the range
771     * of values in the dataset, plus the flag that determines whether or not
772     * the base value for the bars should be included in the range.
773     *
774     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
775     * @param includeInterval  include the interval if the dataset has one?
776     *
777     * @return The range (or {@code null} if the dataset is
778     *         {@code null} or empty).
779     */
780    @Override
781    public Range findRangeBounds(CategoryDataset dataset,
782            boolean includeInterval) {
783        if (dataset == null) {
784            return null;
785        }
786        Range result = super.findRangeBounds(dataset, includeInterval);
787        if (result != null) {
788            if (this.includeBaseInRange) {
789                result = Range.expandToInclude(result, this.base);
790            }
791        }
792        return result;
793    }
794
795    /**
796     * Returns a legend item for a series.
797     *
798     * @param datasetIndex  the dataset index (zero-based).
799     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
800     *
801     * @return The legend item (possibly {@code null}).
802     */
803    @Override
804    public LegendItem getLegendItem(int datasetIndex, int series) {
805
806        CategoryPlot cp = getPlot();
807        if (cp == null) {
808            return null;
809        }
810
811        // check that a legend item needs to be displayed...
812        if (!isSeriesVisible(series) || !isSeriesVisibleInLegend(series)) {
813            return null;
814        }
815
816        CategoryDataset dataset = cp.getDataset(datasetIndex);
817        String label = getLegendItemLabelGenerator().generateLabel(dataset,
818                series);
819        String description = label;
820        String toolTipText = null;
821        if (getLegendItemToolTipGenerator() != null) {
822            toolTipText = getLegendItemToolTipGenerator().generateLabel(
823                    dataset, series);
824        }
825        String urlText = null;
826        if (getLegendItemURLGenerator() != null) {
827            urlText = getLegendItemURLGenerator().generateLabel(dataset,
828                    series);
829        }
830        Shape shape = lookupLegendShape(series);
831        Paint paint = lookupSeriesPaint(series);
832        Paint outlinePaint = lookupSeriesOutlinePaint(series);
833        Stroke outlineStroke = lookupSeriesOutlineStroke(series);
834
835        LegendItem result = new LegendItem(label, description, toolTipText,
836                urlText, true, shape, true, paint, isDrawBarOutline(),
837                outlinePaint, outlineStroke, false, new Line2D.Float(),
838                new BasicStroke(1.0f), Color.BLACK);
839        result.setLabelFont(lookupLegendTextFont(series));
840        Paint labelPaint = lookupLegendTextPaint(series);
841        if (labelPaint != null) {
842            result.setLabelPaint(labelPaint);
843        }
844        result.setDataset(dataset);
845        result.setDatasetIndex(datasetIndex);
846        result.setSeriesKey(dataset.getRowKey(series));
847        result.setSeriesIndex(series);
848        if (this.gradientPaintTransformer != null) {
849            result.setFillPaintTransformer(this.gradientPaintTransformer);
850        }
851        return result;
852    }
853
854    /**
855     * Draws the bar for a single (series, category) data item.
856     *
857     * @param g2  the graphics device.
858     * @param state  the renderer state.
859     * @param dataArea  the data area.
860     * @param plot  the plot.
861     * @param domainAxis  the domain axis.
862     * @param rangeAxis  the range axis.
863     * @param dataset  the dataset.
864     * @param row  the row index (zero-based).
865     * @param column  the column index (zero-based).
866     * @param pass  the pass index.
867     */
868    @Override
869    public void drawItem(Graphics2D g2, CategoryItemRendererState state,
870            Rectangle2D dataArea, CategoryPlot plot, CategoryAxis domainAxis,
871            ValueAxis rangeAxis, CategoryDataset dataset, int row,
872            int column, int pass) {
873
874        // nothing is drawn if the row index is not included in the list with
875        // the indices of the visible rows...
876        int visibleRow = state.getVisibleSeriesIndex(row);
877        if (visibleRow < 0) {
878            return;
879        }
880        // nothing is drawn for null values...
881        Number dataValue = dataset.getValue(row, column);
882        if (dataValue == null) {
883            return;
884        }
885
886        final double value = dataValue.doubleValue();
887        PlotOrientation orientation = plot.getOrientation();
888        double barW0 = calculateBarW0(plot, orientation, dataArea, domainAxis,
889                state, visibleRow, column);
890        double[] barL0L1 = calculateBarL0L1(value);
891        if (barL0L1 == null) {
892            return;  // the bar is not visible
893        }
894
895        RectangleEdge edge = plot.getRangeAxisEdge();
896        double transL0 = rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(barL0L1[0], dataArea, edge);
897        double transL1 = rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(barL0L1[1], dataArea, edge);
898
899        // in the following code, barL0 is (in Java2D coordinates) the LEFT
900        // end of the bar for a horizontal bar chart, and the TOP end of the
901        // bar for a vertical bar chart.  Whether this is the BASE of the bar
902        // or not depends also on (a) whether the data value is 'negative'
903        // relative to the base value and (b) whether or not the range axis is
904        // inverted.  This only matters if/when we apply the minimumBarLength
905        // attribute, because we should extend the non-base end of the bar
906        boolean positive = (value >= this.base);
907        boolean inverted = rangeAxis.isInverted();
908        double barL0 = Math.min(transL0, transL1);
909        double barLength = Math.abs(transL1 - transL0);
910        double barLengthAdj = 0.0;
911        if (barLength > 0.0 && barLength < getMinimumBarLength()) {
912            barLengthAdj = getMinimumBarLength() - barLength;
913        }
914        double barL0Adj = 0.0;
915        RectangleEdge barBase;
916        if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
917            if (positive && inverted || !positive && !inverted) {
918                barL0Adj = barLengthAdj;
919                barBase = RectangleEdge.RIGHT;
920            }
921            else {
922                barBase = RectangleEdge.LEFT;
923            }
924        }
925        else {
926            if (positive && !inverted || !positive && inverted) {
927                barL0Adj = barLengthAdj;
928                barBase = RectangleEdge.BOTTOM;
929            }
930            else {
931                barBase = RectangleEdge.TOP;
932            }
933        }
934
935        // draw the bar...
936        Rectangle2D bar;
937        if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
938            bar = new Rectangle2D.Double(barL0 - barL0Adj, barW0,
939                    barLength + barLengthAdj, state.getBarWidth());
940        }
941        else {
942            bar = new Rectangle2D.Double(barW0, barL0 - barL0Adj,
943                    state.getBarWidth(), barLength + barLengthAdj);
944        }
945        if (state.getElementHinting()) {
946            KeyedValues2DItemKey key = new KeyedValues2DItemKey(
947                    dataset.getRowKey(row), dataset.getColumnKey(column));
948            beginElementGroup(g2, key);
949        }
950        if (getShadowsVisible()) {
951            this.barPainter.paintBarShadow(g2, this, row, column, bar, barBase,
952                true);
953        }
954        this.barPainter.paintBar(g2, this, row, column, bar, barBase);
955        if (state.getElementHinting()) {
956            endElementGroup(g2);
957        }
958        
959        CategoryItemLabelGenerator generator = getItemLabelGenerator(row,
960                column);
961        if (generator != null && isItemLabelVisible(row, column)) {
962            drawItemLabel(g2, dataset, row, column, plot, generator, bar,
963                    (value < 0.0));
964        }
965
966        // submit the current data point as a crosshair candidate
967        int datasetIndex = plot.indexOf(dataset);
968        updateCrosshairValues(state.getCrosshairState(),
969                dataset.getRowKey(row), dataset.getColumnKey(column), value,
970                datasetIndex, barW0, barL0, orientation);
971
972        // add an item entity, if this information is being collected
973        EntityCollection entities = state.getEntityCollection();
974        if (entities != null) {
975            addItemEntity(entities, dataset, row, column, bar);
976        }
977
978    }
979    
980    /**
981     * Calculates the available space for each series.
982     *
983     * @param space  the space along the entire axis (in Java2D units).
984     * @param axis  the category axis.
985     * @param categories  the number of categories.
986     * @param series  the number of series.
987     *
988     * @return The width of one series.
989     */
990    protected double calculateSeriesWidth(double space, CategoryAxis axis,
991                                          int categories, int series) {
992        double factor = 1.0 - getItemMargin() - axis.getLowerMargin()
993                            - axis.getUpperMargin();
994        if (categories > 1) {
995            factor = factor - axis.getCategoryMargin();
996        }
997        return (space * factor) / (categories * series);
998    }
999
1000    /**
1001     * Draws an item label.  This method is overridden so that the bar can be
1002     * used to calculate the label anchor point.
1003     *
1004     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1005     * @param data  the dataset.
1006     * @param row  the row.
1007     * @param column  the column.
1008     * @param plot  the plot.
1009     * @param generator  the label generator.
1010     * @param bar  the bar.
1011     * @param negative  a flag indicating a negative value.
1012     */
1013    protected void drawItemLabel(Graphics2D g2,
1014                                 CategoryDataset data,
1015                                 int row,
1016                                 int column,
1017                                 CategoryPlot plot,
1018                                 CategoryItemLabelGenerator generator,
1019                                 Rectangle2D bar,
1020                                 boolean negative) {
1021
1022        String label = generator.generateLabel(data, row, column);
1023        if (label == null) {
1024            return;  // nothing to do
1025        }
1026
1027        Font labelFont = getItemLabelFont(row, column);
1028        g2.setFont(labelFont);
1029        Paint paint = getItemLabelPaint(row, column);
1030        g2.setPaint(paint);
1031
1032        // find out where to place the label...
1033        ItemLabelPosition position;
1034        if (!negative) {
1035            position = getPositiveItemLabelPosition(row, column);
1036        }
1037        else {
1038            position = getNegativeItemLabelPosition(row, column);
1039        }
1040
1041        // work out the label anchor point...
1042        Point2D anchorPoint = calculateLabelAnchorPoint(
1043                position.getItemLabelAnchor(), bar, plot.getOrientation());
1044
1045        if (isInternalAnchor(position.getItemLabelAnchor())) {
1046            Shape bounds = TextUtils.calculateRotatedStringBounds(label,
1047                    g2, (float) anchorPoint.getX(), (float) anchorPoint.getY(),
1048                    position.getTextAnchor(), position.getAngle(),
1049                    position.getRotationAnchor());
1050
1051            if (bounds != null) {
1052                if (!bar.contains(bounds.getBounds2D())) {
1053                    if (!negative) {
1054                        position = getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback();
1055                    }
1056                    else {
1057                        position = getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback();
1058                    }
1059                    if (position != null) {
1060                        anchorPoint = calculateLabelAnchorPoint(
1061                                position.getItemLabelAnchor(), bar,
1062                                plot.getOrientation());
1063                    }
1064                }
1065            }
1066
1067        }
1068
1069        if (position != null) {
1070            TextUtils.drawRotatedString(label, g2,
1071                    (float) anchorPoint.getX(), (float) anchorPoint.getY(),
1072                    position.getTextAnchor(), position.getAngle(),
1073                    position.getRotationAnchor());
1074        }
1075    }
1076
1077    /**
1078     * Calculates the item label anchor point.
1079     *
1080     * @param anchor  the anchor.
1081     * @param bar  the bar.
1082     * @param orientation  the plot orientation.
1083     *
1084     * @return The anchor point.
1085     */
1086    private Point2D calculateLabelAnchorPoint(ItemLabelAnchor anchor,
1087                                              Rectangle2D bar,
1088                                              PlotOrientation orientation) {
1089
1090        Point2D result = null;
1091        double offset = getItemLabelAnchorOffset();
1092        double x0 = bar.getX() - offset;
1093        double x1 = bar.getX();
1094        double x2 = bar.getX() + offset;
1095        double x3 = bar.getCenterX();
1096        double x4 = bar.getMaxX() - offset;
1097        double x5 = bar.getMaxX();
1098        double x6 = bar.getMaxX() + offset;
1099
1100        double y0 = bar.getMaxY() + offset;
1101        double y1 = bar.getMaxY();
1102        double y2 = bar.getMaxY() - offset;
1103        double y3 = bar.getCenterY();
1104        double y4 = bar.getMinY() + offset;
1105        double y5 = bar.getMinY();
1106        double y6 = bar.getMinY() - offset;
1107
1108        if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.CENTER) {
1109            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y3);
1110        }
1111        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE1) {
1112            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y4);
1113        }
1114        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE2) {
1115            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y4);
1116        }
1117        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE3) {
1118            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y3);
1119        }
1120        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE4) {
1121            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y2);
1122        }
1123        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE5) {
1124            result = new Point2D.Double(x4, y2);
1125        }
1126        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE6) {
1127            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y2);
1128        }
1129        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE7) {
1130            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y2);
1131        }
1132        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE8) {
1133            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y2);
1134        }
1135        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE9) {
1136            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y3);
1137        }
1138        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE10) {
1139            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y4);
1140        }
1141        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE11) {
1142            result = new Point2D.Double(x2, y4);
1143        }
1144        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE12) {
1145            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y4);
1146        }
1147        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE1) {
1148            result = new Point2D.Double(x5, y6);
1149        }
1150        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE2) {
1151            result = new Point2D.Double(x6, y5);
1152        }
1153        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE3) {
1154            result = new Point2D.Double(x6, y3);
1155        }
1156        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE4) {
1157            result = new Point2D.Double(x6, y1);
1158        }
1159        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE5) {
1160            result = new Point2D.Double(x5, y0);
1161        }
1162        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE6) {
1163            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y0);
1164        }
1165        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE7) {
1166            result = new Point2D.Double(x1, y0);
1167        }
1168        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE8) {
1169            result = new Point2D.Double(x0, y1);
1170        }
1171        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE9) {
1172            result = new Point2D.Double(x0, y3);
1173        }
1174        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE10) {
1175            result = new Point2D.Double(x0, y5);
1176        }
1177        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE11) {
1178            result = new Point2D.Double(x1, y6);
1179        }
1180        else if (anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.OUTSIDE12) {
1181            result = new Point2D.Double(x3, y6);
1182        }
1183
1184        return result;
1185
1186    }
1187
1188    /**
1189     * Returns {@code true} if the specified anchor point is inside a bar.
1190     *
1191     * @param anchor  the anchor point.
1192     *
1193     * @return A boolean.
1194     */
1195    private boolean isInternalAnchor(ItemLabelAnchor anchor) {
1196        return anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.CENTER
1197               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE1
1198               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE2
1199               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE3
1200               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE4
1201               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE5
1202               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE6
1203               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE7
1204               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE8
1205               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE9
1206               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE10
1207               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE11
1208               || anchor == ItemLabelAnchor.INSIDE12;
1209    }
1210
1211    /**
1212     * Tests this instance for equality with an arbitrary object.
1213     *
1214     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1215     *
1216     * @return A boolean.
1217     */
1218    @Override
1219    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1220        if (obj == this) {
1221            return true;
1222        }
1223        if (!(obj instanceof BarRenderer)) {
1224            return false;
1225        }
1226        BarRenderer that = (BarRenderer) obj;
1227        if (this.base != that.base) {
1228            return false;
1229        }
1230        if (this.itemMargin != that.itemMargin) {
1231            return false;
1232        }
1233        if (this.drawBarOutline != that.drawBarOutline) {
1234            return false;
1235        }
1236        if (this.maximumBarWidth != that.maximumBarWidth) {
1237            return false;
1238        }
1239        if (this.minimumBarLength != that.minimumBarLength) {
1240            return false;
1241        }
1242        if (!Objects.equals(this.gradientPaintTransformer, that.gradientPaintTransformer)) {
1243            return false;
1244        }
1245        if (!Objects.equals(this.barRendererProduct.getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback(), that.barRendererProduct.getPositiveItemLabelPositionFallback())) {
1246            return false;
1247        }
1248        if (!Objects.equals(this.barRendererProduct.getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback(), that.barRendererProduct.getNegativeItemLabelPositionFallback())) {
1249            return false;
1250        }
1251        if (!this.barPainter.equals(that.barPainter)) {
1252            return false;
1253        }
1254        if (this.shadowsVisible != that.shadowsVisible) {
1255            return false;
1256        }
1257        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.shadowPaint, that.shadowPaint)) {
1258            return false;
1259        }
1260        if (this.shadowXOffset != that.shadowXOffset) {
1261            return false;
1262        }
1263        if (this.shadowYOffset != that.shadowYOffset) {
1264            return false;
1265        }
1266        return super.equals(obj);
1267    }
1268
1269    /**
1270     * Provides serialization support.
1271     *
1272     * @param stream  the output stream.
1273     *
1274     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1275     */
1276    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1277        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1278        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.shadowPaint, stream);
1279    }
1280
1281    /**
1282     * Provides serialization support.
1283     *
1284     * @param stream  the input stream.
1285     *
1286     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1287     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1288     */
1289    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1290            throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1291        stream.defaultReadObject();
1292        this.shadowPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1293    }
1294
1295        public Object clone() throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException {
1296                BarRenderer clone = (BarRenderer) super.clone();
1297                clone.barRendererProduct = (BarRendererProduct) this.barRendererProduct.clone();
1298                return clone;
1299        }
